name: geopm

variants.name: coverage
variants.description: Enable test coverage support, enables debug by default.

variants.name: overhead
variants.description: Enable GEOPM to calculate and display time spent in GEOPM API calls.

variants.name: procfs
variants.description: Enable procfs (disable for OSes not using procfs).

description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependencies.name: ruby-ronn
dependencies.description:
Ronn builds manuals. It converts simple, human readable textfiles to
roff for terminal display, and also to HTML for the web.

dependencies.name: doxygen
dependencies.description:
Doxygen is the de facto standard tool for generating documentation from
annotated C++ sources, but it also supports other popular programming
languages such as C, Objective-C, C#, PHP, Java, Python, IDL (Corba,
Microsoft, and UNO/OpenOffice flavors), Fortran, VHDL, Tcl, and to some
extent D..

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
MVAPICH2-GDR is an optimized version of the MVAPICH2 MPI library for
GPU-enabled HPC and Deep Learning Applications. MVAPICH2-GDR is not
installable from source and is only available through a binary mirror.
If you do not find the binary you're looking for, send us an email at
mvapich@cse.ohio-state.edu. The binary mirror url is:
http://mvapich.cse.ohio-state.edu/download/mvapich/spack-
mirror/mvapich2-gdr/

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: numactl
dependencies.description: NUMA support for Linux

dependencies.name: hwloc
dependencies.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.

dependencies.name: json-c
dependencies.description: A JSON implementation in C.

dependencies.name: py-cycler
dependencies.description: Composable style cycles.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-tables
dependencies.description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.

dependencies.name: py-cffi
dependencies.description: Foreign Function Interface for Python calling C code

dependencies.name: py-pyyaml
dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.

dependencies.name: py-mock
dependencies.description:
mock is a library for testing in Python. It allows you to replace parts
of your system under test with mock objects and make assertions about
how they have been used.

dependencies.name: py-future
dependencies.description: Clean single-source support for Python 3 and 2

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-natsort
dependencies.description: Simple yet flexible natural sorting in Python.

dependencies.name: py-psutil
dependencies.description:
psutil is a cross-platform library for retrieving information on running
processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network) in
Python.

dependencies.name: py-pylint
dependencies.description: python code static checker

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
